channel.description: Recent content in üè¢ UC Berkeley on HF Daily Paper Reviews by AI

item.title: S*: Test Time Scaling for Code Generation
item.description: S*: Hybrid test-time scaling for code generation, boosting both coverage and selection accuracy.

item.title: Autellix: An Efficient Serving Engine for LLM Agents as General Programs
item.description: Autellix: Efficient LLM Serving for Agents

item.title: Pre-training Auto-regressive Robotic Models with 4D Representations
item.description: ARM4R pre-trains autoregressive robotic models using low-level 4D representations from human videos, achieving efficient transfer learning and improved task performance across various environments.

item.title: LLMs Can Easily Learn to Reason from Demonstrations Structure, not content, is what matters!
item.description: LLMs can be effectively taught complex reasoning via efficient fine-tuning on demonstration data focusing on structure, not content, of the reasoning process.

item.title: Lifelong Sequential Knowledge Editing without Model Degradation
item.description: ENCORE enables lifelong sequential knowledge editing in LLMs without performance loss, achieving 10,000 edits while maintaining downstream accuracy.

item.title: SFT Memorizes, RL Generalizes: A Comparative Study of Foundation Model Post-training
item.description: Reinforcement learning (RL) surpasses supervised fine-tuning (SFT) in fostering generalization in foundation models, while SFT aids RL’s stability; a comparative study across text and visual domains r…

item.title: FAST: Efficient Action Tokenization for Vision-Language-Action Models
item.description: FAST: A novel action tokenization method using discrete cosine transform drastically improves autoregressive vision-language-action models’ training and performance, enabling dexterous and high-freque…

item.title: An Empirical Study of Autoregressive Pre-training from Videos
item.description: Toto, a new autoregressive video model, achieves competitive performance across various benchmarks by pre-training on over 1 trillion visual tokens, demonstrating the effectiveness of scaling video mo…

item.title: Training Software Engineering Agents and Verifiers with SWE-Gym
item.description: SWE-Gym, a novel environment for training real-world software engineering agents using 2,438 real-world Python task instances, achieves new state-of-the-art performance and is publicly available.

item.title: Maximizing Alignment with Minimal Feedback: Efficiently Learning Rewards for Visuomotor Robot Policy Alignment
item.description: RAPL efficiently aligns robots with human preferences using minimal feedback by aligning visual representations before reward learning.

item.title: Predicting Emergent Capabilities by Finetuning
item.description: Predicting emergent LLM capabilities is now possible by finetuning smaller models; this approach shifts the emergence point, enabling accurate predictions of future model performance, even with up to …
